item.title: Gambling command problem :/ cnt seem to see whats wrong
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s because one searches for what slot the item is in, and the other expects the item to be in a specific slot (which you specify).

Read full topic

item.title: Gambling command problem :/ cnt seem to see whats wrong
item.dc:creator: @Quintorz Quintorz
item.description:
@Quintorz wrote:

there is 2 wtf

[code]public void deleteItem(int id, int amount) {
if(id <= 0)
return;
for (int j = 0; j < c.playerItems.length; j++) {
if (amount <= 0)
break;
if (c.playerItems[j] == id+1) {
c.playerItems[j] = 0;
c.playerItemsN[j] = 0;
amount–;
}
}
resetItems(3214);
}

public void deleteItem(int id, int slot, int amount) {
	if(id <= 0 || slot < 0) {
		return;
	}
	if (c.playerItems[slot] == (id+1)) {
		if (c.playerItemsN[slot] > amount) {
			c.playerItemsN[slot] -= amount;
		} else {
			c.playerItemsN[slot] = 0;
			c.playerItems[slot] = 0;
		}
		resetItems(3214);
	}
}[/code]

item.title: Gambling command problem :/ cnt seem to see whats wrong
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

Wow, no wonder it doesn’t work thats a terrible looking bit of code for something so simple.

try this it could be done better but meh

if (playerCommand.startsWith("gamble")) { String[] amount = playerCommand.split(" "); int amount2 = Integer.parseInt(amount[1]); if (amount2 > 1000000) { c.sendMessage("You can only bet a max of 1m"); return; } if (amount.length == 2) { if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, amount2)) { c.getItems().deleteItem2(995, amount2); int r = Misc.random(100); if (r >= 55) c.getItems().addItem(995, amount2 * 2); c.sendMessage(r >= 55 ? "The dice landed on "+r+" You doubled your money!" : "The dice landed on "+r+" you lost your cash"); } else c.sendMessage("You don't have enough cash"); } else c.sendMessage("Use the command properly ::gamble cashamount"); }

@matzie wrote:

first off use playerCommand.substring(5)
then it doesn’t have to be 7 digits exactly
you define roll twice.
your deleteItem must have the error, post it?

item.title: Gambling command problem :/ cnt seem to see whats wrong
item.dc:creator: @Quintorz Quintorz
item.description:
@Quintorz wrote:

so i created this gambling command:D
it worked find until i lost 1 round…

it took all my money when i lost, and i cnt seem to find out why… but the reward worked:)
ive been looking at it for a while and cnt seem to find the “mistake”

Here is the code

if(playerCommand.startsWith("dice")){ int args = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(5,12)); int roll = Misc.random(99)+1; if (args >= 1 && c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, args) || args <= 1000000 && c.getItems().playerHasItem(995, args)){ roll = Misc.random(99)+1; c.sendMessage("the number the dice landed on is: "+roll); if (roll >= 55){ c.getItems().addItem(995,args); c.sendMessage("Congratulations you have won:"+ args+" Coins!"); } else if (roll <= 54){ c.getItems().deleteItem(995 , args); c.sendMessage("Sadly you just lost: "+args+" Coins"); } } else{ c.sendMessage("Invalid number, pick a number in between 1 and 1m"); c.sendMessage("Use it as ::dice 0000500 ETC, it has to have 7 numbers"); } }
